00001 # Name:    bindings.tcl
00002 # Author:  Trevor Williams  (phase1geo@gmail.com)
00003 # Date:    5/12/2013
00004 # Brief:   Handles menu bindings from configuration file
00005 
00006 namespace eval bindings {
00007 
00008   source [file join $::tke_dir lib ns.tcl]
00009   
00010   variable base_bindings_file [file join $::tke_dir data bindings menu_bindings.[tk windowingsystem].tkedat]
00011   variable user_bindings_file [file join $::tke_home menu_bindings.[tk windowingsystem].tkedat]
00012 
00013   array set menu_bindings {}
00014   
00015   #######################
00016   #  PUBLIC PROCEDURES  #
00017   #######################
00018   
00019   ######################################################################
00020   # Loads the bindings information
00021   proc load {} {
00022   
00023     # Load the menu bindings file
00024     load_file
00025     
00026   }
00027   
00028   ######################################################################
00029   # Adds the global menu bindings file to the editor as a read-only file.
00030   proc view_global {} {
00031     
00032     variable base_bindings_file
00033     
00034     gui::add_file end $base_bindings_file -sidebar 0 -readonly 1
00035     
00036   }
00037   
00038   ######################################################################
00039   # Adds the user menu bindings file to the editor.
00040   proc edit_user {} {
00041     
00042     variable user_bindings_file
00043     
00044     gui::add_file end $user_bindings_file -sidebar 0 -savecommand bindings::load_file
00045     
00046   }
00047   
00048   ########################
00049   #  PRIVATE PROCEDURES  #
00050   ########################
00051   
00052   ######################################################################
00053   # Polls on the bindings file in the tke home directory.  Whenever it
00054   # changes modification time, re-read the file and store it in the
00055   # menu_bindings array
00056   proc load_file {} {
00057   
00058     variable base_bindings_file
00059     variable user_bindings_file
00060     variable menu_bindings
00061     
00062     if {[file exists $user_bindings_file]} {
00063       remove_all_bindings
00064       if {![catch { tkedat::read $base_bindings_file 0 } rc]} {
00065         array set menu_bindings $rc
00066       }
00067     } else {
00068       remove_all_bindings
00069       copy_default 0
00070     }
00071     
00072     if {![catch { tkedat::read $user_bindings_file 0 } rc]} {
00073       array set menu_bindings $rc
00074       apply_all_bindings
00075     } else {
00076       array unset menu_bindings
00077     }
00078     
00079   }
00080 
00081   ######################################################################
00082   # Applies the current bindings from the configuration file.
00083   proc apply_all_bindings {} {
00084 
00085     variable menu_bindings
00086     variable bound_menus
00087     
00088     array unset bound_menus
00089     
00090     foreach {mnu binding} [array get menu_bindings] {
00091       set menu_list [split $mnu /]
00092       if {![catch { menus::get_menu [lrange $menu_list 0 end-1] } mnu]} {
00093         if {![catch { $mnu index [msgcat::mc [lindex $menu_list end]] } menu_index] && ($menu_index ne "none")} {
00094           set bound_menus($mnu) [list $menu_index $binding]
00095           $mnu entryconfigure $menu_index -accelerator $binding
00096           bind all [accelerator_to_sequence $binding] "menus::invoke $mnu $menu_index; break"
00097         }
00098       }
00099     }
00100     
00101   }
00102   
00103   ######################################################################
00104   # Removes all of the menu bindings.
00105   proc remove_all_bindings {} {
00106   
00107     variable menu_bindings
00108     variable bound_menus
00109     
00110     # Delete all of the accelerators and bindings
00111     foreach {mnu data} [array get bound_menus] {
00112       $mnu entryconfigure [lindex $data 0] -accelerator ""
00113       bind all <[lindex $data 1]> ""
00114     }
00115    
00116     # Delete the menu_bindings array
00117     array unset menu_bindings
00118     
00119   }
00120   
00121   ######################################################################
00122   # Convert the Tcl binding to an appropriate accelerator.
00123   proc accelerator_to_sequence {accelerator} {
00124     
00125     set sequence "<"
00126     set shifted  0
00127     
00128     # Create character to keysym mapping
00129     array set mapping {
00130       Ctrl      "Control-"
00131       Alt       "Alt-"
00132       !         "exclam"
00133       \"        "quotedbl"
00134       \#        "numbersign"
00135       \$        "dollar"
00136       %         "percent"
00137       '         "quoteright"
00138       (         "parenleft"
00139       )         "parenright"
00140       *         "asterisk"
00141       +         "plus"
00142       ,         "comma"
00143       -         "minus"
00144       .         "period"
00145       /         "slash"
00146       :         "colon"
00147       ;         "semicolon"
00148       <         "less"
00149       =         "equal"
00150       >         "greater"
00151       ?         "question"
00152       @         "at"
00153       \[        "bracketleft"
00154       \\        "backslash"
00155       \]        "bracketright"
00156       ^         "asciicircum"
00157       _         "underscore"
00158       `         "quoteleft"
00159       \{        "braceleft"
00160       |         "bar"
00161       \}        "braceright"
00162       ~         "asciitilde"
00163     }
00164     
00165     # If we are on a Mac, convert the Cmd string to the Command string
00166     if {[tk windowingsystem] eq "aqua"} {
00167       array set mapping {
00168         Cmd   "Command-"
00169         Super "Command-"
00170       }
00171     } else {
00172       array set mapping {
00173         Cmd   "Command-"
00174         Super "Meta-"
00175       }
00176     }
00177     
00178     # Create the sequence
00179     foreach value [split $accelerator -] {
00180       if {[info exists mapping($value)]} {
00181         append sequence $mapping($value)
00182       } elseif {$value eq "Shift"} {
00183         set shifted 1
00184       } else {
00185         if {$shifted} {
00186           append sequence [string toupper $value]
00187         } else {
00188           append sequence [string tolower $value]
00189         }
00190       }
00191     }
00192     
00193     append sequence ">"
00194 
00195     return $sequence
00196     
00197   }
00198   
00199   ######################################################################
00200   # Copies the default settings to the user's .tke directory.
00201   proc copy_default {{load 1}} {
00202   
00203     variable base_bindings_file
00204     
00205     # Copy the default bindings to the tke home directory
00206     file copy -force $base_bindings_file $::tke_home
00207     
00208     # Load the file
00209     if {$load} {
00210       load_file
00211     }
00212     
00213   }
00214 
00215 }
00216 
00217
